data.name: Hummus
data.description: Creamy chickpea and tahini spread, brightened with lemon juice and olive oil.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil (+ extra for drizzling)
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth.
Drizzle olive oil on top and garnish.

data.name: Baba Ghanoush
data.description: Smoky roasted eggplant dip, rich with tahini, garlic, and lemon.
instructions: Roast or char eggplant until softened; peel and drain.
Mash pulp and mix with remaining ingredients.

data.name: Koshary
data.description: Egypt’s comfort dish: layered lentils, rice, pasta, tomato sauce, chickpeas, and crispy onions.
ingredients: Macaroni or small pasta like ditalini
instructions: Cook lentils until tender; in some versions, combine with rice in the same pot.
Cook pasta separately until al dente.
Prepare the tomato sauce by sautéing aromatics, then simmering tomatoes with spices and vinegar until thickened.
Fry onions (often coated in flour/cornstarch) until golden and crispy.
If using, prepare additional sauces like garlic-vinegar or shatta.
Assemble: Layer lentils/rice, pasta, then top with chickpeas, tomato sauce, crispy onions, and drizzle with garlic-vinegar and/or shatta sauce.

data.name: Mujaddara
data.description: Comforting Levantine dish of lentils and rice topped with caramelized onions.
instructions: Cook lentils and rice separately.
Sauté onions until golden.
Combine rice and lentils; top with onions.

data.name: Tabbouleh
data.description: A refreshing parsley, bulgur, tomato, and onion salad, dressed with lemon and olive oil.

data.name: Fattoush salad
data.description: A classic Levantine salad known for its refreshing crunch, combining vegetables, herbs, and toasted pita with a zesty dressing made of lemon and olive oil.
instructions: Toast the pita pieces until golden and crispy
Toss the vegetables and greens in a bowl.
Dress with olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, and salt, mixing gently.
Add pita just before serving to keep it from getting soggy. Serve immediately for the best texture and flavor.

data.name: Falafel
data.description: Crispy, deep-fried chickpea (or fava bean) balls—packed with herbs and spices.
instructions: Soak chickpeas/fava beans (ideally 12–24 hours, often with baking soda)
Blend with herbs, garlic, onion, and spices until finely ground—mixture should resemble coarse sand
Chill the mixture for at least an hour to help it hold shape during frying
Form into balls or patties, then deep-fry in hot oil (approx. 350–375 °F or 175–190 °C) until golden and crisp—approx. 3–5 mins
Drain on paper towels and serve hot, often with pita and tahini.
